channel.title: Bookshelf on Peter Y. Chuang - Novelist, Short Story Writer
channel.description: Recent content in Bookshelf on Peter Y. Chuang - Novelist, Short Story Writer

item.title: Austerlitz
item.description: In search of the past by a man saved from Nazi Germany by Kindertransport

item.title: Love in the Time of Cholera
item.description: Florentino Ariza waited for fifty-one years, nine months, and four days for Fermina Daza to reciprocate his love

item.title: The Lady of the Camellias
item.description: One of the greatest love stories of all time, and the basis for one of the best known operas

item.title: Second-Hand Time
item.description: A moving, powerful, and at times disturbing oral history of the little people of the Soviet Union

item.title: Voices from Chernobyl: The Oral History of a Nuclear Disaster
item.description: The Chernobyl nuclear disaster from the perspective of the little people who lost their homes, families, and countries

item.title: What We Talk About When We Talk About Love
item.description: "What We Talk About When We Talk About Love" is a superb collection of short stories by Raymond Carver

item.title: In Search of Lost Time (Volume 3): The Guermantes Way
item.description: "In Search of Lost Time" is a true literary wonder that, despite its length and at times impregnable prose style, has a incredible charm and attraction.

item.title: In Search of Lost Time (Volume 2): In the Shadow of Young Girls in Flower
item.description: "In Search of Lost Time" is a true literary wonder that, despite its length and at times impregnable prose style, has a incredible charm and attraction.

item.title: In Search of Lost Time (Volume 1): The Way by Swann's
item.description: "In Search of Lost Time" is a true literary wonder that, despite its length and at times impregnable prose style, has a incredible charm and attraction.

item.title: The Hobbit & The Lord of the Rings
War and Peace
item.description: A novelistic account of Napoleon's invasion of Russia, its impact on the Russian society and our beloved characters, and Tolstoy's commentary on how history should be written.

item.title: Anna Karenina
item.description: A classic story of love, adultery, family, and everything else.
